originContent: > 1. All these API keys, configurations, and services are **required**.
translatedContent: > 1. Todas essas chaves de API, configura√ß√µes e servi√ßos s√£o **obrigat√≥rios**.

originContent: > 2. Agent Backbone Recommendation: Use Claude for the Research Agent and Gemini for the Design Agent. GLM-4.7 is also a good choice in open-source models.
translatedContent: > 2. Recomenda√ß√£o de Backbone de Agente: Use Claude para o Agente de Pesquisa e Gemini para o Agente de Design. GLM-4.7 tamb√©m √© uma boa op√ß√£o entre os modelos open-source.

originContent: > 3. Offline mode is supported with limited capabilities (see Offline Setup below).
translatedContent: > 3. O modo offline √© suportado com funcionalidades limitadas (veja Configura√ß√£o Offline abaixo).
- **Crie arquivos de configura√ß√£o** (a partir da raiz do projeto):

originContent: - **MinerU**: Apply for an API key at [mineru.net](https://mineru.net/apiManage/docs). Note that each key is valid for 14 days.
translatedContent: - **MinerU**: Solicite uma chave de API em [mineru.net](https://mineru.net/apiManage/docs). Observe que cada chave √© v√°lida por 14 dias.

originContent: - **Tavily**: Apply for an API key at [tavily.com](https://www.tavily.com/).
translatedContent: - **Tavily**: Solicite uma chave de API em [tavily.com](https://www.tavily.com/).

originContent: - **LLM**: Set your model endpoint, API keys, and related parameters in `config.yaml`.
translatedContent: - **LLM**: Defina o endpoint do seu modelo, chaves de API e par√¢metros relacionados em `config.yaml`.

originContent: - **MinerU**: Deploy the MinerU server by following the instructions at [MinerU docker guide](https://opendatalab.github.io/MinerU/quick_start/docker_deployment/#start-services-directly-with-docker-compose)
translatedContent: - **MinerU**: Implemente o servidor MinerU seguindo as instru√ß√µes em [Guia Docker do MinerU](https://opendatalab.github.io/MinerU/quick_start/docker_deployment/#start-services-directly-with-docker-compose)

originContent: - **Config switch**: Set `offline_mode: true` in [`config.yaml`](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/icip-cas/PPTAgent/main/deeppresenter/deeppresenter/config.yaml) to avoid loading network-dependent tools (e.g., `fetch`, `search`).
translatedContent: - **Altern√¢ncia de configura√ß√£o**: Defina `offline_mode: true` em [`config.yaml`](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/icip-cas/PPTAgent/main/deeppresenter/deeppresenter/config.yaml) para evitar o carregamento de ferramentas dependentes da rede (por exemplo, `fetch`, `search`).

originContent: - **MinerU endpoint**: Set `MINERU_API_URL` in [`mcp.json`](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/icip-cas/PPTAgent/main/deeppresenter/deeppresenter/mcp.json) to your local MinerU service URL
translatedContent: - **Endpoint do MinerU**: Defina `MINERU_API_URL` em [`mcp.json`](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/icip-cas/PPTAgent/main/deeppresenter/deeppresenter/mcp.json) para a URL do seu servi√ßo MinerU local
Construa as imagens docker: `docker compose build`

originContent: - #### Prompt: Please present the given document to me.
translatedContent: - #### Prompt: Please present the given document to me.

originContent: If you find this project helpful, please use the following to cite it:
translatedContent: If you find this project helpful, please use the following to cite it:

originContent: title = "{PPTA}gent: Generating and Evaluating Presentations Beyond Text-to-Slides",
translatedContent: title = "{PPTA}gent: Generating and Evaluating Presentations Beyond Text-to-Slides",

originContent: booktitle = "Proceedings of the 2025 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing",
translatedContent: booktitle = "Proceedings of the 2025 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing",

originContent: abstract = "Automatically generating presentations from documents is a challenging task that requires accommodating content quality, visual appeal, and structural coherence. Existing methods primarily focus on improving and evaluating the content quality in isolation, overlooking visual appeal and structural coherence, which limits their practical applicability. To address these limitations, we propose PPTAgent, which comprehensively improves presentation generation through a two-stage, edit-based approach inspired by human workflows. PPTAgent first analyzes reference presentations to extract slide-level functional types and content schemas, then drafts an outline and iteratively generates editing actions based on selected reference slides to create new slides. To comprehensively evaluate the quality of generated presentations, we further introduce PPTEval, an evaluation framework that assesses presentations across three dimensions: Content, Design, and Coherence. Results demonstrate that PPTAgent significantly outperforms existing automatic presentation generation methods across all three dimensions."
translatedContent: abstract = "Automatically generating presentations from documents is a challenging task that requires accommodating content quality, visual appeal, and structural coherence. Existing methods primarily focus on improving and evaluating the content quality in isolation, overlooking visual appeal and structural coherence, which limits their practical applicability. To address these limitations, we propose PPTAgent, which comprehensively improves presentation generation through a two-stage, edit-based approach inspired by human workflows. PPTAgent first analyzes reference presentations to extract slide-level functional types and content schemas, then drafts an outline and iteratively generates editing actions based on selected reference slides to create new slides. To comprehensively evaluate the quality of generated presentations, we further introduce PPTEval, an evaluation framework that assesses presentations across three dimensions: Content, Design, and Coherence. Results demonstrate that PPTAgent significantly outperforms existing automatic presentation generation methods across all three dimensions."
